name: Barbell Standing Lunges
how_to_perform:
1. Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and parallel to each other.
2. Take a large step forward with one foot, keeping your back leg locked in place. Lower your body down into a lunge position, keeping your front knee at a 90-degree angle.
3. Hold the weight with both hands and keep your chest up and head level as you lower yourself down into the lunge.
4. Make sure to keep your back straight and engage your core muscles throughout the exercise.
5. Pause for a brief moment at the bottom of the movement, then push through the front heel to return to standing position.
6. Repeat on the other side by stepping forward with the other foot.
short_summary: Barbell Standing Lunges are an effective lower body exercise that work multiple muscle groups, using dumbbells as additional resistance
